Package cafe.models

Class Order

java.lang.Object
cafe.models.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
Customizable
public class Order extends Object implements Customizable
An order for the store. This class follows the singleton design pattern as multiple controllers need to be able to update the same instance consistently. Once the order is finalized, the singleton is re-instantiated. This abstraction proves to be very effective in our particular use case.
Author:
Reagan McFarland, Vatche Kafafian

    • setId

      public void setId​(int newId)
      Override the ID of an order. Refer to StoreOrders.resetOrderIds() for the reasoning behind why we need this
      Parameters:
      newId - newId for the order

    • getInstance

      public static Order getInstance()
      Retrieve the current order instance. If one does not exist already, it is created.
      Returns:
      Current Order shared instance

    • finalizeOrder

      public void finalizeOrder​(double finalPrice)
      Finalize the given order and send it to StoreOrders.
      Parameters:
      finalPrice - the final price (including tax) of the order This also sets the instance to null, causing the singleton to create a new instance next time this class is called from outside

    • getItemsInOrder

      public ArrayList<MenuItem> getItemsInOrder()
      Get items in order
      Returns:
      items in order

    • getFinalPrice

      public double getFinalPrice()
      Get the final price of an order. This value is only set through finalizeOrder
      Returns:
      final price of order

    • toString

      public String toString()
